p: Besides these neurological presentations, which were considered to be caused directly by the infection, scientists believe that an autoimmune response might have caused delayed neurological complications in these patients. [ 5] As an example, Encephalitis lethargica, a neurological syndrome which widely coincided with, and lasted for a decade after the Spanish Flu pandemic, was believed to be in relation to the influenza infection. [ 5] Moreover, despite controversies, it was shown that Parkinson's disease was two to three times more prevalent among individuals who were born between 1888 and 1924. This group was born or were young at the time of the Spanish Flu pandemic. [ 5]
